sect2.title: Introduction to Fcron
sect2.para: The Fcron package contains a periodical command scheduler which aims at replacing Vixie Cron.

sect2.title: Installation of Fcron
sect2.para: Fcron uses the cron facility of syslog to log all messages. Since LFS does not set up this facility in /etc/syslog.conf, it needs to be done prior to installing Fcron. This command will append the necessary line to the current /etc/syslog.conf:

userinput.command:
cat >> /etc/syslog.conf << "EOF" # Begin fcron addition to /etc/syslog.conf
cron.* -/var/log/cron.log
# End fcron addition EOF

sect2.para: The configuration file has been modified, so reloading the sysklogd daemon will activate the changes.
For security reasons, an unprivileged user and group for Fcron should be created:

userinput.command: groupadd fcron && useradd -d /dev/null -c "Fcron User" -g fcron -s /bin/false fcron

sect2.para: Install Fcron by running the following commands:

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --without-sendmail: Fcron will use an installed MTA to email you the results of the fcron script. If you wish to utilize this feature, change the switch to --with-sendmail=[path to your MTA].

--with-answer-all=no: After the files are installed, the make install script enters into a configuration routine. The first test will be whether to install a boot script in the /etc/rc.d/init.d directory with the appropriate symbolic links in run levels 2, 3, 4, and 5. The second is to stop any current fcron processes and start a new one. Since this is probably your first install and a boot script based upon the BLFS template is desired, answer 'n' to both tests.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: There are no required changes in any of the config files. Configuration information can be found in the man page for fcron.conf.
fcron scripts are written using fcrontab. Refer to the fcrontab man page for proper parameters to address your situation.
Install the /etc/rc.d/init.d/fcron init script from the package.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Fcron package contains fcron, fcrontab, fcronsighup and fcrondyn.

sect3.title: fcrontab
sect3.para: fcrontab is the program used to install, edit, list and remove the tables used by fcron.

sect3.title: fcronsighup
sect3.para: fcronsighup instructs fcron to reread the fcron tables.

sect3.title: fcrondyn
sect3.para: fcrondyn is a user tool intended to interact with a running fcron daemon.
